Regina_Regina:
{{Short description|Former Country Music Duo}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Regina Regina | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = group_or_band | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]] | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 1995-1997 | label = [[Giant Records (Warner)|Giant]] | associated_acts = [[Dave & Sugar]] | past_members = Regina Leigh
Regina Nicks }} '''Regina Regina''' was an American [[country music]] duo formed in 1995. The duo consisted of female singers Regina Leigh and Regina Nicks, respectively natives of [[North Carolina]] and [[Lufkin, Texas]].{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2008|publisher=Record Research, Inc|date=2008|page=347|isbn=978-0-89820-177-2}} Leigh was formerly a backing vocalist in [[Reba McEntire]]'s road band, while Nicks was a personal assistant for McEntire and a former member of [[Dave & Sugar]].{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2199&dat=19970305&id=ZZgyAAAAIBAJ&pg=6496,2485489|title=Regina Regina hopes pairing pays off|last=Patterson|first=Jim|date=5 March 1997|work=[[Lawrence Journal-World]]|accessdate=11 April 2013}} The two met through the assistance of producer [[Wally Wilson]], who wanted to include Nicks in a female duo. Nicks felt that she was unable to find a suitable singing partner until Leigh heard one of her demos and decided that she wanted to work with Nicks. The two were brought to [[Giant Records (Warner)|Giant Records]] then-president [[James Stroud]] in 1995.{{cite magazine|last=Flippo|first=Chet|date=December 14, 1996|title=Giant Squares Away Debut Album from Duo Regina Regina|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|pages=24, 26|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=tQkEAAAAMBAJ&dq=%22regina+regina%22+%22giant%22&pg=PA24}} Regina Regina released its only album in 1997. The duo's only charting single in the U.S. was "More Than I Wanted to Know", which peaked at No. 53 on ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''{{'}}s [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles & Tracks]]. ==Discography== === Albums === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:10em;"| Title ! style="width:18em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''[[Regina Regina (album)|Regina Regina]]'' | * Release date: January 28, 1997 * Label: [[Giant Records (Warner)|Giant Records]] |} === Singles === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:16em;"| Single ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
